nodes.title: #Beijing2022 concluded on Sunday with the closing ceremony. Hereâ€™s the overall medal count. ğŸ¥‡ Look back at this year's Winter Olympic Games. https://t.co/LbgdHe2wEi https://t.co/P4BAr4UG7t

nodes.title: #Beijing2022 was a joyless spectacle: constricted by the pandemic, fraught with geopolitical tensions, tainted by doping accusations and overshadowed by the Ukraine crisis. The Games were a success only as measured by the low bar of avoiding disaster. https://t.co/v3KYZRuCZV

nodes.title:

nodes.title: Elana Meyers Taylor of the U.S. became the most decorated Black athlete in Winter Olympics history on Saturday by winning the bronze medal in the two-woman bobsled event at #Beijing2022. https://t.co/sdQ6kPRqgT https://t.co/jAa4KZbPZz
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Winning gold in #Beijing2022 was vindication for Sui Wenjing and Han Cong of China: They had victory within their grasp at the 2018 Games, but lost the gold by 0.43 points.

This time, they set world records for their short program score and total score. https://t.co/2RhWZbopQ6 https://t.co/qu47v71lf7

Nathan Chen ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸  is a world record holder. 

The figure skating star leapt into first place at #Beijing2022 with an outstanding short program, and set a new world record with his score of 113.97 points. Follow our live Olympics coverage: https://t.co/EtPYxlwuDy https://t.co/qYL8QwpQHc

nodes.title:
Russian figure skaters have won gold in the #Beijing2022 team figure skating event, led by the 15-year-old phenom Kamila Valieva. 

The U.S. won silver, and Japan finished third. https://t.co/VOOkV4TRs9

nodes.title: NBC said the comedian Leslie Jones can continue tweeting about the #Beijing2022 Winter Olympics after she suggested the network was pressuring her to stop. https://t.co/vsf6omEo0y

nodes.title:

His 113.97 points score has set him up for a shot at #Beijing2022 victory. https://t.co/5SuNlDs7qi https://t.co/BMl25CTiHV

nodes.title:
The Olympic Parade of Nations began, as always, with Greece.

The other teams at the #Beijing2022 opening ceremony will enter based on their order in the Chinese language. The U.S. will be the 56th to enter the stadium.

Follow our updates.
https://t.co/WblMarrKyh https://t.co/IsJbWl5yZV
